creditline: Gift of Mary and Bob Mersky
medium: Archival pigment print on photographic paper, cut and folded
provenance: The artist, Germany; [Von Lintel Gallery, Los Angeles, sold to Mersky, July 13, 2017]; Robert B. Mersky, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2022.
text: Merging aspects of photography and sculpture, Christiane Feser cuts, folds, and manipulates two-dimensional photographs of constellations into unique relief-like works that bring material and image into perfect balance. In this example from the series Partitionen (Partitions), Feser deftly explores questions of perception, spatial illusion, and the generation of meaning. At once playful and conceptually challenging, Feser’s construction demands close inspection and quiet observation to fully appreciate its latent visual and perceptual potential.
title: Partition 81
